persons.name: Epikrates
persons.role: Official or individual mentioned in the heading

rationale: This inscription is a famous example of a parapegma from Miletus. It functions as a scientific calendar, correlating the solar year with the stellar phases (risings and settings of constellations like the Pleiades, Scorpio, and Arcturus) and predicting meteorological phenomena like winds (Boreas), thunder, and hail. It cites the comparative observations of famous astronomers like Eudoxus of Cnidus, Conon of Samos, Euctemon, and Philippus of Opus.
